channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dangerous 12 inch deep hole, 30th July
item.description:
Dog dug, at penalty spot of goal nearest playground.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northbourne Court, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Croft way residents unable to get to there houses due to no yellow lines, 30th July
item.description:
I am writing to express ongoing concerns regarding the parking situation on the narrow road leading to Baxley. Residents have been experiencing severe difficulties for over a year due to vehicles being parked along this narrow stretch. As shown in the attached image, parked cars restrict access to the point where the road becomes virtually impassable for larger vehicles or when two cars meet. Despite repeated complaints and assurances that a meeting would be held to address the matter, no action has been taken. In the meantime, local residents continue to suffer on a weekly basis. We are once again requesting that yellow lines be painted along the road to prevent parking where the width is insufficient. The current situation poses a risk not only to traffic flow but also to emergency access and general safety. We would appreciate an urgent update on when action will finally be taken.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Croft Way, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 mattresses, various chairs SE1 3DL, 30th July
item.description:
Beside the recycling bins between Tomson and Attilburgh House SE1 3DL, we have yet more mattresses, a few chairs, cupboards, broken shelves, pet enclosure and so on. Some of these items have been here since before the weekend (5+ days)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Riley Road, Old Kent Road, London

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 30th July
item.description:
This car was brought up to our car park by tow truck, two weeks ago. Air bags have been activated, so must of been in crash of some sort. Each morning when I look out of my window, the damage is more than day before! I am petrified that this car is going to be set alight! Please can it be towed away ASAP.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Brantwood Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees growing out onto pathway. Causing issues passing and disabled people having to walk out into the road., 30th July

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pole outside my house, 30th July
item.description:
This pole was put in last week without any consideration to ask us as the home owner if this would be ok. I understand there is for the permits but this causes an obstruction outside my house and also an eyesore. We are looking into getting a drive put in which now causes complications due to the nature of where the pole has been placed. Also the cement on the pathway is not secure and the pole is wobbly. I have two children under 5 and if this was to fall on them! I would like the pole removed and placed elsewhere. We already have a lamp post which the permit sign could be added on to instead.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elstree Gardens, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Debris from fly tipping still here, 30th July
item.description:
I’ve had an update to say that the last issue has been resolved this morning. IT HASN’T been resolved - there is rotting meat and food stinking out the whole area. Came from inside the flytipped items. Please sort it out properly

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Monteagle Way, Hackney, London

item.title: Flytipping, 30th July
item.description:
All this junk used to be in the alleyway between 31 and 32 mottingham road that circles round the back of 32 onwards. Someones now moved it from the alleyway onto 31 mottingham road. This is flytipping and is completely unacceptable. I expect its the same person who's left the bag of other junk by the bin as well. Please remove this and investigate who's been flytipping as its clearly a recurring issue now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Mottingham Road, London

item.title: Tree is not growing straight and not supported, 30th July
item.description:
This tree is not growing straight - it has been like this for a number of years, there appears to have been an attempt to support the tree in the past but the posts are loose and the strap is now broken and the tree continues to grow sideways. Can this be fixed please and the tree better supported?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stapleton Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Industrial skip being used for domestic waste disposal, 30th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Road, Penge, London

item.title: Bins on Innes Street overflowing, lots of litter on the street, 30th July
item.description:
The bins on Inness street are constantly overflowing, trash spilling onto the pavement and surrounding areas. Large items like cardboard boxes and discarded furniture are frequently left next to the bins, creating an ongoing obstruction for pedestrians. This has become a recurring issue, making the area unsightly and difficult to navigate.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innes Street, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
